chapter.title: Release notes
chapter.para: For each release of Flashlight there are new and noteworthy features to try out, and known limitations to avoid or workaround. These are presented in the sections below for each released version of Flashlight.

sect1.title: Flashlight version 3.0.0
sect1.para: This section describes the 3.0.0 release of Flashlight.

sect2.title: New and Noteworthy
sect2.para: This section describes new and noteworthy features in this version of Flashlight.

listitem.para: Launch JUnit tests directly from Flashlight. — You can now run Flashlight on a JUnit test using the launcher. Right click on the test class, and choose Flashlight As JUnit Test, or configure your test from the Flashlight Configurations pane.

sect2.title: Known Problems
sect2.para: This section describes known bugs and limitations in this version of Flashlight.

listitem.para: Differently instrumented versions of the same file can cause failures. — If two identical class files happen to be on the classpath at once, and one is instrumented while the other is not, then a VerifyError can occur at runtime. The best way to work around this is to make sure that both classes are instrumented or not instrumented. You can do this from the Instrumentation tab in the Flashlight Configurations view.

Preparing very large files will sometimes fail. — Due to a limitation in Flashlight's embedded database implementation, Flashlight is unable to prepare very large files. The maximum size file that can be prepared depends on characteristics of the instrumented program, but as a general rule you shouldn't encounter this problem until your raw file is > 300 MB in size.

sect1.title: Flashlight version 2.3.0
sect1.para: This section describes the 2.3.0 release of Flashlight.

sect2.title: New and Noteworthy
sect2.para: This section describes new and noteworthy features in this version of Flashlight.

listitem.para: The Flashlight Status view provides a quick overview of a run's results. — A new view has been added to make it easier to tell if there are interesting results from a prepared run. The Flashlight Status view indicates if the lock cycle analysis has found any potential deadlocks or if the lock set analysis has detected any possible race conditions. You can double-click on a warning indicator to run the relevant query.
Quickly create tutorial projects — You can now create and start the tutorials from the workspace menu by choosing FlashlightRun the Flashlight Tutorials.
The Flashlight Runs view now shows the total size of each run directory.
